properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:34 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from L'Orignal to Hammond, moving southeast at 75 km/h. Severe thunderstorms will be near: Russell around 8:50 PM EDT. Locations impacted include: Hawkesbury, Kanata, Nepean, Gloucester, Metcalfe, Russell, Bourget, Newington, Westminster, Maxville, Alexandria, Hazeldean, Barrhaven, Manotick, Enniskerry, Kenmore, Marvelville, Vars, Sarsfield and St-Onge. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-14T02:45:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T00:35:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4084429386.2019
Area: Ottawa North - Kanata - Orléans

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning Ended
properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Tornado Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:18 p.m. Central Standard Time Saturday, Environment Canada has updated a tornado warning for South Central Saskatchewan. Extra care and attention should be exercised. The following localities are included in the warning: Craik, Aylesbury, Holdfast, Chamberlain, Dilke, Tuxford, Keeler, Buffalo Pound, Bethune, Findlater, Riverhurst, Douglas Park, Tugaske, Central Butte, Eyebrow and Brownlee. Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking severe thunderstorms that are possibly producing tornadoes. Damaging winds, large hail and locally intense rainfall are possible.

In addition to a tornado, this severe thunderstorm is capable of producing baseball-sized hail and destructive winds in excess of 120 km/h. ### This is a dangerous and potentially life-threatening situation. properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:41 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from L'Orignal to Hammond, moving southeast at 75 km/h. Severe thunderstorms will be near: Russell around 8:50 PM EDT. Locations impacted include: Hawkesbury, Kanata, Nepean, Gloucester, Metcalfe, Russell, Bourget, Newington, Westminster, Maxville, Alexandria, Hazeldean, Barrhaven, Manotick, Enniskerry, Kenmore, Marvelville, Vars, Sarsfield and St-Onge. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-14T02:45:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T00:42:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3949564114.2019
Area: Gatineau
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 36 are expected for the next 2 days. A hot and humid airmass will affect parts of Northwestern Ontario on Sunday and Monday. Daytime high temperatures will be near 29 degrees with humidex values near or above 36. Overnight low temperatures will remain near or above 18 degrees, which will not provide much relief from the heat. There is the potential that these hot conditions will continue on Tuesday. Cooler air is expected Tuesday night. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-14T17:50:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-14T01:51:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1900201559.2019
Area: Kenora - Grassy Narrows - Whitedog, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada
